title: Data Science - First Impressions
text:
Petal Width in iris
I created an R object, y, that is the density estimate of the petal widths in the iris dataset, using this code:

y <- density(iris$Petal.Width)

The class, type, and structure of object y are as follows: Class:

class(y)

[1] "density"


Type:

typeof(y)

[1] "list"


Structure:

str(y)

List of 8
 $ x         : num [1:512] -0.656 -0.648 -0.64 -0.633 -0.625 ...
 $ y         : num [1:512] 0.00161 0.00178 0.00197 0.00217 0.00239 ...
 $ bw        : num 0.252
 $ n         : int 150
 $ old.coords: logi FALSE
 $ call      : language density.default(x = iris$Petal.Width)
 $ data.name : chr "iris$Petal.Width"
 $ has.na    : logi FALSE
 - attr(*, "class")= chr "density"


I then used the plot function on y:
